definition: T-step (basic dance position, with the feet forming a T shape)
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation
to draw together/to place side by side (e.g. one's fingers, two halves of a torn sheet of paper etc)
shape resembling the character 八 or 8/V-shape/splayed/figure of eight
to sway one's hips/to twist one's waist
golden rooster stands on one leg (tai chi posture)/standing on one leg
cat-like gait/sashaying gait of a catwalk model
to walk around the stage (to indicate scene changes)
